snippet: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said Japan will restart its nuclear plants that pass new safety standards, which are expected to be adopted as early as July.
abstract: Prime Min Shinzo Abe says Japan will begin restarting its idled nuclear plants after new safety guidelines are put in place, moving to ensure stable energy supply despite public safety concerns after Fukushima disaster; promise is strongest indication yet that Abe plans to move ahead with campaign promise to reverse his predecessor’s hopes that Japan would begin weaning itself off nuclear energy.

byline.original: By MARTIN FACKLER and HIROKO TABUCHI
byline.contributor: Matthew L. Wald contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Prime Minister Shinzo Abe said Japan will restart its nuclear plants that pass new safety standards, which are expected to be adopted as early as July.

headline.seo: Japan to Begin Restarting Nuclear Plants, Premier Says
headline.main: Japan to Begin Restarting Idled Nuclear Plants, Leader Says
headline.print_headline: Japan to Begin Restarting Idled Nuclear Plants, Premier Says
